Nearly a third of the world’s art treasures reside in this city.
In 1339 became the first city in all of Europe with paved streets.
Pinocchio, the wooden boy whose nose grows when he lies, came from this city.
The emblem of the city is a red lily.
The official language is Vietnamese.
The city name means \"peaceful meeting place\"
Became the first town in Asia to offer free wifi.
Is close to the ocean and to many beaches and fishing villages
Hemingway Lived Here.
Is known for its rum and tobacco.
There is a statue of John Lennon from The Beatles.
The Bolero, Mambo and Cha Cha was invented in the country.
Means Fragrant Harbor
Has more Rolls Royce’s per person than any other city in the world.
Has the most skyscrapers in the world; double of New York City
Its architects take Feng Shui into consideration in the design and construction of buildings.
Is home to the world’s largest collection of art deco architecture.
was once a mangrove swamp and the land we now know was mostly man made.
Sun tan lotion was invented here
Gets its name from one of the tribes that lived here.
Was once an archipelago of 7 islands
has a coastline of about 150 kilometres
is the birthplace of the author of The Jungle Book
There is only 1.1 square metres of open space for people living
Has the largest castle in the world
There is a graffiti wall devoted to John Lennon.
You’ve probably heard of its famous Astronomical Clock
The locals drink more beer per capita than any other nation in the world
Is often known as the ‘World’s Smallest Big City’ or the ‘World’s Biggest Small Town’.
The city’s subway is also known as the world’s longest art gallery
The city is sometimes referred to as ‘Venice of the North’
one of the world’s cleanest metropolises
